alert.note: Alert for Greenlee (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 21 at 8:16PM MST until August 22 at 9:09PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Tucson AZ has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Arizona... Gila River At Gila River at Duncan affecting Greenlee County. For the Upper Gila...including San Carlos Reservoir at Coolidge Dam, Gila River at Calva, Gila River near Solomon, Gila River At Kelvin, Gila River at Duncan...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Gila River At Gila River at Duncan. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 22.0 feet, Major Flood Stage: Large sections of Duncan flood including business district, residences, and Highway 70. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 PM MST Sunday the stage was 14.6 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage late this evening to 20.8 feet late this evening. It will then rise to 21.8 feet late tonight. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - Flood History...No available flood history. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Monday morning at 1000 AM MST.
